greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is number of numbers x, 2^n <= x < 2^(n+1), with k prime factors (counted with multiplicity).
comment: Sequence A092097 gives the limiting behavior at the end of the rows. - T. D. Noe, Feb 22 2008
link: T. D. Noe, Rows n=1..24 of triangle, flattened
example: a(7) = 5 because the 3-almost primes between 16 and 32 are (18,20,27,28,30).
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := Count[Range[2^n, 2^(n+1)-1], x_ /; Total[FactorInteger[x][[All, 2]]] == k]; Table[t[n, k], {n, 1, 12}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 07 2013 *)
xref: A001222 counts factors of n. A000040, A001358, A014612-A014614 are special cases. A036378 and A025488 are applications of binary order A029837. Leading diagonal is essentially A036378 and has partial sums A007053.
results.author: _Alford Arnold_
